document.heading: Lead Hazard Prevention and Elimination Amendment Act of 2010

history.narrative: Law 18-348, the “Lead Hazard Prevention and Elimination Amendment Act of 2010”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-64, which was referred to the Committee Government Operations and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 23, 2010, and December 7, 2010, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 19, 2011, it was assigned Act No. 18-697 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-348 became effective on March 31, 2011.

AN ACT IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA To amend the Lead Hazard Prevention and Elimination Act of 2008 to expand protections for pregnant women and children under 6 years of age, to modify disclosure requirements, to expand the permissible use of the Lead Poisoning Prevention Fund, to require the Mayor to report on its implementation, to require permission of a tenant for inspections unless a warrant is obtained, and to amend the Housing Regulations of the District of Columbia to make conforming amendments.
